VLC, Windows Media Player, EMP Classic, etc. Most players can now play most MKV files as long as you have the right codec(s) installed.

Though Mplayer (For Linux or Windows) is the best video player in my opinion.

People shouldn't mind MKV's: It's foolish. In this case, the MKV container was not taken advantage of (subtitles/chapters/etc), so an MP4 container will also work. Feel free to do that on your own.

Video: H264, 608x464 (1.31 AR), 950 Kbps, 30 Fps
Audio: AAC, Stereo, 130 Kbps
Notes: Source quality varies tremendously: some video segments are VHS quality (very soft, tracking lines), some video/picture segments are DVD quality. Great encode and release.
